alert.note: Alert for Lower Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 28 at 10:31AM PST until February 28 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: .Slow moving front will bring steady rain to the coastal areas, as well as the Willapa Hills and Coast Range of far northwest Oregon. Rainfall of 2 to 5 inches can be expected across this region, with many rivers on the rise today into Tuesday. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, including the following areas, in northwest Oregon, Lower Columbia. In southwest Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and South Washington Cascade Foothills. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain expected. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
